semantic_title: COVID-19 Infection in Newborn Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 16. Chapter 16: Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period > h. COVID-19 Infection in Newborn

content.full_text: For a newborn that tests positive for COVID-19, assign code U07.1, COVID-19, and the appropriate codes for associated manifestation(s) in neonates/newborns in the absence of documentation indicating a specific type of transmission. For a newborn that tests positive for COVID-19 and the provider documents the condition was contracted in utero or during the birth process, assign codes P35.8, Other congenital viral diseases, and U07.1, COVID-19. When coding the birth episode in a newborn record, the appropriate code from category Z38, Liveborn infants according to place of birth and type of delivery, should be assigned as the principal diagnosis. (Evidence: pg no: 74, L63-L65)
content.summary: COVID-19 in newborns requires U07.1 plus manifestation codes, with P35.8 added when transmission is documented as in utero or during birth, and Z38 as principal for birth episodes (Evidence: pg no: 74, L63-L65)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For newborn testing positive for COVID-19, assign U07.1 and manifestation codes when transmission type not documented (Evidence: pg no: 74, L63-L64)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a newborn tests positive for COVID-19 without specific documentation of transmission method, use the standard COVID-19 code plus any associated manifestations (Evidence: pg no: 74, L63-L64)
common_applications: Newborn with positive COVID test, no transmission details
COVID-19 with respiratory symptoms in newborn

detailed_rules.rule_text: When COVID-19 transmission is documented as in utero or during birth, assign P35.8 and U07.1 (Evidence: pg no: 74, L64)
detailed_rules.explanation: When provider specifically documents that COVID-19 was contracted in utero or during the birth process, both the congenital viral disease code and COVID-19 code are required (Evidence: pg no: 74, L64)
common_applications: Maternal COVID during pregnancy with fetal transmission

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z38 should be assigned as principal diagnosis for birth episodes with COVID-19 (Evidence: pg no: 74, L64-L65)
detailed_rules.explanation: The standard birth episode coding hierarchy applies even when COVID-19 is present, with Z38 remaining the principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 74, L64-L65)
common_applications: All birth admissions where newborn has COVID-19

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm newborn tested positive for COVID-19
Step 2: Check documentation for transmission type
Step 3: If transmission not specified, assign U07.1 plus manifestations
Step 4: If in utero/birth transmission documented, assign P35.8 and U07.1
Step 5: For birth episodes, assign Z38 as principal diagnosis
Step 6: Sequence COVID codes as secondary diagnoses
